hints_html:
The amount of Vitamin A is

concentration x volume.

You need to multiply the concentration and the disk-volume for every infinitly small disk and then integrate over all disks.

infinitly small disk and then integrate over all disks.
hints_raw:
The amount of Vitamin A is

 concentration x volume.
You need to multiply the concentration and the disk-volume for every infinitly small disk and then integrate over all disks.
question: 5 (b)
sols_html:
To find the amount A of Vitamin A in the carrot, we need to multiply every infinitly small disk with unit \(cm^3\) with the passend concentration of Vitamin A and then integrate over all disks:

\[\begin{aligned} A &= \int_0^{12}\frac{1}{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\left(\sqrt{14-x}\right)^2\pi dx \\ &= \frac{\pi}{12}\int_0^{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}(14-x)dx\\ &= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \int_0^{12}xe^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx\right]\end{aligned}\]

We let the former integral as is for now and use integration by parts for the latter. Let u = x, du = dx, dv = e-x/12dx and v = -12e-x/12. Then

\[\begin{aligned} A &= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \int_0^{12}xe^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx\right] \\ &= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \left(\left.x(-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\right|_0^{12} - \int_0^{12} (-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx\right)\right] \\ &= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[ 14\int_0^{12} e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx - 12\int_0^{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx+(12)(12)e^{-1}-0\right] \\ &= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[ 2\int_0^{12} e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx + (12)(12)e^{-1}\right] \\ &= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[\left.2(-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\right|_0^{12} + (12)(12)e^{-1}\right]\\ &= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[-2(12)(e^{-1}-1)+(12)(12)e^{-1}\right] \\ &= \pi\left[-2e^{-1}+2+12e^{-1}\right] \\ &= \pi\left[\frac{10}{e}+2\right] \\ &= \frac{2\pi(5+e)}{e}.\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
To find the amount \emph{A} of Vitamin A in the carrot, we need to
multiply every infinitly small disk with unit $cm^3$ with the passend
concentration of Vitamin A and then integrate over all disks:

\begin{align*}
A &= \int_0^{12}\frac{1}{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\left(\sqrt{14-x}\right)^2\pi dx \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12}\int_0^{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}(14-x)dx\\
 &= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \int_0^{12}xe^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx\right]
\end{align*}

We let the former integral as is for now and use integration by parts
for the latter. Let \emph{u = x}, \emph{du} = \emph{dx}, \emph{dv} =
\emph{e}\textsuperscript{-\emph{x}/12}\emph{dx} and v =
-12\emph{e}\textsuperscript{-\emph{x}/12}. Then

\begin{align*}
A &= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \int_0^{12}xe^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \left(\left.x(-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\right|_0^{12} - \int_0^{12} (-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx\right)\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[ 14\int_0^{12} e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx - 12\int_0^{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx+(12)(12)e^{-1}-0\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[ 2\int_0^{12} e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx + (12)(12)e^{-1}\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[\left.2(-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\right|_0^{12} + (12)(12)e^{-1}\right]\\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[-2(12)(e^{-1}-1)+(12)(12)e^{-1}\right] \\
&= \pi\left[-2e^{-1}+2+12e^{-1}\right] \\
&= \pi\left[\frac{10}{e}+2\right] \\
&= \frac{2\pi(5+e)}{e}.
\end{align*}
sols_raw:
To find the amount ''A'' of Vitamin A in the carrot, we need to multiply every infinitly small disk with unit <math>\ cm^3</math> with the 
passend concentration of Vitamin A and then integrate over all disks:

:<math>\begin{align}
A &= \int_0^{12}\frac{1}{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\left(\sqrt{14-x}\right)^2\pi dx \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12}\int_0^{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}(14-x)dx\\
 &= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \int_0^{12}xe^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx\right]
\end{align}</math>

We let the former integral as is for now and use integration by parts for the latter. Let ''u = x'', ''du'' = ''dx'', ''dv'' = ''e''<sup>-''x''/12</sup>''dx'' and v = -12''e''<sup>-''x''/12</sup>. Then

<math> \begin{align}
A &= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \int_0^{12}xe^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \left(\left.x(-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\right|_0^{12} - \int_0^{12} (-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx\right)\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[ 14\int_0^{12} e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx - 12\int_0^{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx+(12)(12)e^{-1}-0\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[ 2\int_0^{12} e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx + (12)(12)e^{-1}\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[\left. 2(-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\right|_0^{12} + (12)(12)e^{-1}\right]\\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[-2(12)(e^{-1}-1)+(12)(12)e^{-1}\right] \\
&= \pi\left[-2e^{-1}+2+12e^{-1}\right] \\
&= \pi\left[\frac{10}{e}+2\right] \\
&= \frac{2\pi(5+e)}{e}.
\end{align}
</math>
statement_html:
A carrot has the shape formed by revolving the region under the graph of

\[\begin{aligned} f(x) = \sqrt{14-x}\end{aligned}\]

for \(0 \leq x \leq 12\) cm about the x axis. The concentration of vitamin A is found to vary in the carrot with x according to

\[\begin{aligned} c(x) = \frac1{12} e^{-x/12} \frac{\text{mg}}{\text{cm}^3}\end{aligned}\]

What is the total amount of vitamin A in the carrot?
statement_raw:
A carrot has the shape formed by revolving the region under the graph of

:<math> f(x) = \sqrt{14-x} </math>

for <math> 0 \leq x \leq 12 </math> cm about the ''x'' axis. The concentration of vitamin A is found to vary in the carrot with ''x'' according to 

:<math> c(x) = \frac1{12} e^{-x/12} \frac{\text{mg}}{\text{cm}^3} </math>

[[File:Math_Exam_Resources_Courses_MATH103_April_2009_Question_5_(a)_5a.png|350px]]

What is the total amount of vitamin A in the carrot?
